content: The story was interesting enough and I enjoyed many of the characters. That said, I would happily punch my character in the face. The way he'd gush over every hero that would appear on screen made me cringe so hard. Plus the fact that any time he entered a fight he always seemed to humiliate himself, no matter what I tried. It felt like I had no control on my character's personality or actions and it is very frustrating.
Needs an option to save and load the game at different points of the story
Garbage
Disappointed, no true choice.. and ending feels cheated. Just my opinion, but seriously let down by this one.
For those who have good imagination. The possibilities are very good, and different. You really have a feeling that you are involved
*How it feels reading a COG game* Bop bop bop Plibasience bop bop bop bop bop petiligularated bop bop bop tryzakidamine bop.
Your choice didn't matter at all and the ending is horrible

I've played a lot of Choice Of games and this is by far the worst among them. There are no actual choices in this game. You have the option to select one thing or another but the following page will always provide the same exact result. A love interest exists in the game too but the gender doesn't change depending on your own and they give off a very.. rapey vibe. The author should've just wrote a short story since that's all this is.
Best Game Ever!!! One of the more enjoyable games you will find, you will feel immersed and develop a bond with the characters making the the experience all the more greater. :)
Very fun and interesting storytelling game twist ending is too predictable though
Pretty good game! I like that it has the two sequels. Of course you must buy the last two. Wish they were a few dollars less. But overall I would recommend this game to anyone who likes superheroes.
Wonderful Story - I bought the whole series
I love the story

The story is very linear, with a few paths you could take with very obvious choices. Even then, the choices you make don't really matter because you get the same immediate response. There are a few good parts in the writing, but the rest is mediocre. Instead of being sprinkled throughout the story, exposition is given through lengthy reports or speeches. Worst of all, the story tries really hard to force you into a romance with a certain character, whose 'flirting' borders harassment.
I loved this game. It was enjoyable and I looked forward to playing it a lot! I feel like I could really connect with the characters.

Surprisingly really exciting and innovative. Although, with a genre such as Superheroes, it would be better if the reader gets to customise their powers/skill sets and approach to problems instead of set-in-stone powers. That would definitely help with the immersion. Otherwise, a solid experience for an entry read. Good world building.

the writing is very good, unfortunately as a game it falls flat. it doesnt do a great job of signposting what choices leverage which attributes, nor does it have enough detail in action descriptions to let you figure out what is the best choice. Paul Wang's infinity series, The Lost Heir Series, and Kyle Marquis' games all have roughly comparable writjng with better game mechanics. try those games first.
This is like that best interactive book/game you will ever find out there

Overall, I enjoyed the game. The author really managed to create an enjoyable story that I was thoroughly entertained by. Not to mention how interesting the worldbuilding is. However, there are several flaws regarding thos: -The lack of interactivity. Many points in the game will force your character to react in some way with no choices given whatsoever -Biased stats. The game seems to encourage the player to lean towars justice, lawful, defense, team, with many reprecautions to other stats.
It's really fun. Good variety of choices. Well built world.
Love this series!

Experience this story to experience the other two. This one is an intro, a beginning, and really only sets the foundation for the adventure that unfolds in "The Hero Peoject" and "Herofall". The Prodigy is only the beginning and sets the tone for everything else that happens.
amazing and I love playing the series
Good writing and an enjoyable experience.
Ah, this game is decent, but the force choices sucks you can't really make decisions.
I have really enjoyed it. This is my third time downloading to replay! If you enjoy chose your own adventure I highly suggest this series!
I didn't feel like I had much freedom when I played this. The romantic subplots are handled very poorly, and the protagonist's backstory is too set-in-stone for this to be a real Choice Of game.
I loved the game! Sometimes it was hard to do what you actually thought was right.
Had a lot of fun playing this, really hard to stick to your own ideals in this one. Great work!
Awesome writing, engaging story

Zachary Sergi (the author) has managed to do something in this trilogy of stories that doesn't often happen to me, he made me genuinely care about the characters. While, yes I do believe that the choices in this one don't really matter at first, they do matter in the long run over the three stories. I truly recommended this series to anyone that enjoys actions superhero stories and if you just like a thrilling story or rant sure where you stand on them I say give it a go anyway, you might just like it

I enjoyed the game... sort of. It's not like the writing was bad or lazy, just.. that it felt really narrow in what you 'should' or could do. With the legend system, while I see the goal, it feels like it wants you to be a very specific type of character, enforced more so by the 'romance'. The sole romance option is almost nauseatingly 2 dimensional, and says you like this person before you even have a choice to... Not. Adding on, the way they address lgbt+ things are almost superficial. I've seen others complain about it being shoved down their throats, but to me it feels like it was put in last minute, feels basically like the creator doesn't actually care or know anything about the subject (like calling it orientationism which is like they're afraid of using actual terms)... it just feels gross, how it's included. I'm a gay trans guy and this just bugged tf outta me. I just didn't enjoy it. It's not bad, but just very.. set in stone story for yourself. What you choose doesn't change much besides end game rating, which wasn't satisfying like it should have been... Bonus.. the cheat sheet is extra money, when it's typically a community effort to find their best endings, or at least fun ones. Tldr I'd get a refund because a few disgruntled and spiteful playthroughs later, I can't bring myself to remotely like it, but ofc that's not an option. It just feels shallow.

Wonderful! Fantastic story, meaningful choices, deep characterisation, great replay value and the story itself is extremely well written. It's emotionally engaging, so that you become deeply immersed in the story world.

I loved this. Definitely should try to partner with Ubisoft and develop a 
game. I'd definitely buy that

I'm really disappointed with this game. Your choices don't matter save for 
shallow cosmetics. Sure it offers several interesting moral dilemmas, but 
they don't hold up the story (which is only amusing for the first or second 
play through). If you've got cash and time to burn, give it a shot, but 
it's really not worth it.
Great. Along with the rest of the series.

The story itself and the idea are pretty good. The problem is how it's laid 
out. At times the game was pretty boring. I didn't get into it that much. 
The ending was interesting, but that's about all I can say about it. It's 
not bad, but I'd recommend something else if you're looking for a game to 
play.

It's a pretty good story that's sometimes bogged down by the LGBTBBQ 
narrative that sometimes feels like it's being shoved down the reader's 
throat, trying to appear 'natural'.

It's trash. So many people say that these are the best CoG has to offer, but after finally trying it I can only wonder what they were thinking. There is little to no actual choice with any significant impact, and you're pidgeonholed into most relationships. No matter what you choose, at the end of the game you're family has a high rep with you, the mayor has a low rep, etc. And I must have told the game I have no interest in Black Magic at least 3 or 4 times, yet the game kept acting like I wanted nothing more than to be with her constantly. It feels like you're playing the authors character, and you get punished for making choices the author doesn't want you to make. Definitely one of the worst CoG I've played.

Tl;dr = No character control, decent story. Honestly, the player character annoys the hell out of me. I don't like him at all. He just feels too idealistic and cliche. You can control what he does, but almost nothing about who he is. Tried playing this a while ago, because people keep saying it is one of the best, but couldn't get into it. Now I'm trying to power through, despite my complete and utter lack of investment, so I can finish the trilogy. This is because despite the fact I don't really like any of the characters, at least the story seems interesting. Maybe I will find something to like, but so far that looks bleak.

As a story, it's pretty good. As a game, not so much.                                                                         Throughout most of it, I was invested because I believed my choices mattered. But towards the end, my choices were taken away from me. Decisions were made for me, based on my initial feelings; many of which had changed by the end. I had become disillusioned with certain characters and wanted to leave them, but wasn't allowed to because my stats hadn't dropped enough. It felt inorganic and not how I would've reacted in such situations, which goes against the point of these games. Overall I enjoyed the ride, but was disappointed by the landing.
üëåüèΩüëåüèΩüëåüèΩüëåüèΩ
It just doesn't give you that many actual choices.

Absolutely love this interactive novel, every Penny of mine was well spent.. The story is engaging and close to humanity nature, not the normal holier than thou heroes drama.. I totally feel for Black Magic/Lucia, and am glad that she found someone trust worthy and love her in me... I will never betray her and am willing to stand by her till the end
Wonderful book, wonderful series. I'm hooked!
I've only just started but I'm really enjoying it. The story just keeps moving and it's very riveting.

I was immersed in the story telling from the moment I started reading. I am glad I found you through Community College Hero! I played through all three in 2 days... would have been 1 but I had to sleep haha this is my second favorite of the series !   Absolutely loved the trilogy and can't wait to see what your brain comes up with next!

When I first read the chapter I wasnt interested as I didnt rly care about wannabe Heroes. However after playing Versus, I decided to give this game a try since it was written by the same author. Author did a good job on creating an engaging story that made you think and glued especially the 2nd part of the series. Im playing the third one right now but I highly recommend buying from the 1st one before buying 2nd or the 3rd. Good job COG team. Note I bought almost all COG game and few Hosted ones. I must say these series are on my favorite list along with Meta Human and Versus.
Amazing

Cool yet somehow I felt like I was tailored to lose, like my choices made my hero just...fail. Legend score? Right, just tell me I am a loser outright. No villain options? Cause if ya gonna suck, might just lose it and kill everyone.

This was my second Choice of Games text RPG and I must say it's way better than my initial foray. In fact, I really liked this one due to the complex nature of the decisions my superhero character has to make. I could do without the 'romance' aspect. Not that I'm anti-romance in any way, but it was handled in a rather juvenile almost Twilight-esque manner. Frankly, there was something a bit squick-worthy in how the potential 'love interest' kept kissing my heroine before she could give full consent. However, I loved the relationship between my character and her grandmother (loved the sentient plants). There were some interesting twists and turns that I didn't see coming. Overall, I liked this so much that I've just bought and downloaded the sequel.
Awesome, enjoyed it so much as well as the sequels and hope for amazing content as soon as possible! for anyone who is on the fence about paying money for it; its worth every penny.

The literary quality of this game is amazing. I almost just had to start taking it at face value as a good piece of literature instead of a "game" because of how well the story is incorporated into the player's choices. The character development is superb, and the twists and turns are edgy and really force you to think about your decisions. Love!!!
Ive played most of the series and the experience its taken me on was awesome. Great game

Your decisions mean less in this game than they do in any other  choice of game. You cannot choose to be a villain. Youre dragged through the same downfall no matter what options you choose. Too many commas in the wrong places. They don't know what the definition of "prodigal" is.

It's an alright story, but it's really linear. Aside from small things like costume and power color, favorite hero, etc the story is laid out in stone it seems, nearly unflinching. Only changing who likes you. Which seems to be no almost one. Which is understandable as the Mc is kinda a fool. Save your money, Go get Robots.
I have played and beaten the series and loved it. 100%
I was just wondering how to create an account so I can continue the stats from before?

Loved the story, I got hooked immediately and and have gone through the entire series several times. Even though the choices didn't seem to have an immediate effect, I felt like it stacked up with other decisions in the later stories. I NEED more of these kind of ultra-good stories!

I am completely and utterly astonished at how engaging this 'game' is. The other choice of games have been great but this one truly stands out. I really feel like I AM the character. Anybody who passes this up is really missing out on one of the best game you'll ever find to date on a mobile device.
Brilliant in every way
I wish there was more choice in creating your character instead of the powers just given to you. Sorta wanted to be the batman/green arrow type of hero
It was enjoyable but not enough so to spend $3 on. I'd understand $1.99 or less.
I've been a long time fan of these text games and Heroes Rise is another hit! Now I'm off to continue my story in the second game.
Great game
played way better ones than this. poor
Decent story but your choices dont mean anything, railroaded.

I loved this series so much, seriously. Buy all three parts of this story, then The Hero Project Redemption Season because they are all worth the read. Hats off to the author, you've made an amazing series and I can't wait to see what you've got in store for us next.
Don't trust the fake 5 stars this game is bad
An excellent up and comer super hero story

I've been binge reading this series for a few days now, and I'm currently in the middle of Hero Project: Redemption. The story line is so inticing and the characters are unique and thought out. There are quite a few grammatical errors; however, the substance of the story and character developement do far more than make up for these errors.... each entry in this epic series is more than worth their price.
I really did like this gme and am looking forward to the next games

Incoherent, nonsensical setting. Choices that don't really matter. A constant feeling of being railroaded by the plot (and getting screwed over every step of the way). This is the worst Choices game I've played. It managed to suck out all the fun you would think you'd have being a superhero.
Don't play this at 4 A.M. in the morning... the feelsüòÇüò£üò•üòçüò£üò±üò®üò±üòµüò≠üò¢üò•üòÜ

I'm just here to echo the other reviews. At first I was hesitant to spend money on this even with the glowing reviews, I'm a naturally skeptical man myself. But this entire series is exceedingly well written, your choices matter and its world is amazing. If you love Cyoa, start here and find out for yourself that I'm not just some paid reviewer.
The name says it all
Read through all three novels. Absolute masterpiece. Thank you so much for the incredible journey.
your choices will effect later chapters in the story

This is it. Personally I can't stand reading things overwhelmingly optimistic, which I'd expected from the description. I was wrong and judged a book by it's cover. This whole series is great. There are complaints of it being too linear and not having your choices affect too much, but I feel like that's kinda necessary for it to be a series. The further you get, the more you see the changes. This one mostly sets up the other parts to the series. Definitely worth getting.
Not much to say. This game, the whole trilogy, is amazing. Fun, funny, engaging, dramatic...not much can be said beyond the corny "If you play one Choice Of game..."
Just buy it, you won't be disappointed at all the story, the character development, the twists and turns will have you hooked. Trust me just buy it

You aren't really given a clear indication of how you make choices in a lot of major cases. For example, does making a grab for a powerful weapon a choice based on greed or because you don't want it to fall into bad hands?

Frankly boring, and predictable. Choices didn't seem to matter at all. If you want a depressing game where every action leads to nothing good, then sure, this is a good game. Otherwise, pick up Choice of Robots or Choice of Pirates. Way better.

Shallow, crude, linear - expecting you to follow a certain path or face disappointment. The only "real" choices are cosmetic. This game is made to humiliate, moralize and belittle. The exact opposite from what "choice" games should be.

I have only played one play through... But, I could tell how linear the story was... It's also not very gripping... Mostly the decisions range from kick or punch... I also restarted the game to find out choosing another option produced the exact same result. If you are looking for a super hero game choose "Community College Hero".
A great series.  I can't wait for more.
Storyline is so engrossing I stayed up late to complete it. Loved the characters too, they were super well done.

This was one of the best games by choice of games, second only to robots. The one thing that crushed my experience with this game is the loss of sparrow. I actually felt attached to her, but boy do I get a pleasant surprise when she reveals herself to be flipping prodigal. That put me through a sour mood for the rest of the game and sequels.
I've had this for quite some time and I still enjoy going back to play it. The worst part was waiting for the sequels.

I liked this game pretty well. It's interesting to form relationships with people around you (in the story), but I did feel like I was pushed into decisions I didn't want to make. It seemed like each decision I made was having a negative effect of some kind. It seems that, possibly, your early decisions (when you don't know the serious ramifications) are very difficult to come back from. If you say one wrong thing early on, it seems to set the tone for your relationships or stats for the rest of the game. I did enjoy choosing which powers to use, and I enjoyed that, at the end of the game, you have the option to upload your game and save it to the Choice of Games server, meaning that you can use your hero and past choices in future installments of Heroes Rise.
With interactive stories is that your choices effect the stats but in this all the hero rise stories the stats effect the choices fix it and you got a perfect story
Great story continued through 2 sequels to make one epic saga.

A guy posted earlier an example of why the game wasn't top notch, saying you choose your favorite hero in the beginning and it tells you that someone else is your hero unless you picked that hero. That is false information, if you pay attention to the game you will realize this. He is correct about actions not affecting the story too much, but it's still a great story, and just like mass effect, the choices in this story affect the other games. So buy the whole series, not just this one.
Great story
Amazing story!!!! Please make more I was held captive by your game and played all three for hours and hours. Really great stuff please make more like this or keep this hero universe alive.

Good story for a starting out hero. There's a lot of struggle and it feels like things are more out of control than you'd like, but this is understandable in a way for a starting-out hero. The concepts here were great but I won't spoil anything.
Magnificent story! I love the entire trilogy and I'm satisfied with my choices! Please continue this series!!
It feels like no matter what you choose, the game plays out a same. A huge dissapointment compared to all of their other games, which are so much better.
Great start to an amazing trilogy!
Loved every minute. Each battle, each choice, all wrapped together for one epic story.

Coming off of other, similar games where choices actually affected the story in meaningful ways, I was disappointed. In this game, it seemed that the moment you make a choice, the very next paragraph of story either continues like you didn't even make a choice or immediately undermines your decision. example: you have to choose your favorite hero early in the game; the rest of the game constantly tells you that your hero is someone else unless you happened to pick that pre-ordained person.
Played it many times.
Slugging awesome
This story was just so AWESOME! It had the correct balance of action, amazingly done plot, and makes you wanna read the next chapter.This book is worth the money

But not thrilled by it once I did a few more play throughs. Because even if you choose completely different choices, 90% of the time it gives you the exact same response. And, honestly, this story makes your hero seem like a complete idiot during the fighting scenes no matter what choices you choose, because your hero will manage to screw up every time. I'm going to give the next one a shot to see if it's better and adds to the story.
This novel is GREAT. Gotta love the choices you could make.
Stumbled up on this gem by mistake. After reading the trilogy, I got to say this was the best "mistake" in my life

Some consequence's choices aren't very visible. And some choices seem useless (the battle choices). The other choices seems always to miss a little what you want to do and some give just dumb responses. Added with the fact that you can't rewind, it's a little frustrating.  The game is rather cheap and maybe it's just me who has problem with these choices, so I still recommend to try it.  But I have played Choice of robots (from the same company) and loved it far far far more. So... Your choice ! ;)
I bought all three games to see where the story would lead and I'm glad I did
This trilogy, along with several other of your games, has succeeded in consuming about an entire week of my life. And I look forward to spending even more time with them!

This game is unbelievably good I beat all three of them in a week I seriously could not stop reading this stuff and to the people who made this game I like to give a sincere thank you this is by far one of the most enjoyable games I have played in my life and considering I normally go for graphically flashy games and this game has no graphics to speak of it really says a lot about the quality of the material
So good
Honestly, this whole series was well done. I hope to see more.
Good game
Awesome
The whole trilogy was incredible and left me gripped and invested till the end. Enjoyed every minute.
Zachary Sergi is a great author , Awesome story and interesting characters

I was thinking about buying this game and the rest of the series but decided to just get the first one and see how it went. I've played other Choice Of Games titles and this one never really drew me in. Wish I had played it quicker so I could've gotten the refund.
I love this game and i recommend the whole series 10/10. Worth the price, always play it when I'm bored.

Need more of this series! I love love love love it! Love all the choice games but this is so far and away the best! Have been on a rollercoaster of emotions, that are so deep as you really become the main character, and your connections to other characters is so strong you really feel the decisions you make. I am now so emotionally invested in this series and need more. And I'm someone who is generally quite emotionless! Get the whole series people you'll never regret it it's the best thing!

Its not bad and its not great either. Dissapointed surely after having played Choice of Robots. This however have little replayability value. The story is set out for you already, and the choices doesn't really affect it that much. The twists in the plot are good, but i don't see much character growth. You start off with a teenager drooling over your main interest, ugh. And end up still that teenager, ugh.
The writing is okay, a but ham-fisted, even for the genre. Your choices seem to be almost entirely irrelevant, which is very disappointing.
Doesnt really give you a whole lot of choice. Makes some decisions for you, and tells you how you should feel at certain parts. Its ok, not the best stoy ive read but desently entertaining

But hate that I keep buying them lol, no really they are amazing you'll keep wanting more and more is what I mean. love the choice of game "games" because truly I see them as books and I loved the choose your own adventure books as a child so these are an absolute must if you loved those and still do.
Great story and I couldn't stop playing it. Great for people who love adventure!

I really love the storytelling. Characters are cool too and the decision making is good, somewhat useless at times but still worth your time. The "combat" is also quite strategic at times,  although sometimes it doesn't really matter what you do. I still rate this 5 because it's a very enjoyable adventure.

This game is a huge disappointment. The big problem is that your decisions dont matter. The cool thing about choose your own adventure books is that the world stays the same but you can adventure differently each time you read. Not in this book. Over 90% percent of the story is the same no matter what you do. At some points it will blatantly ignore what you choose so that parts can be reused. At the end, the author gives up wanting to work on this and the reading level nosedives.
Worth buying.and very fun, i wish you had the choice of your powers but it was great
Totally blown away by this game
Great Storyline!
Game fun, but very glitchy, I kept having to restart game to even play. Not worth the money to expand it
Fun, but it left me wanting more. I'm already hoping for a vampire sequel, so this is just going to be annoying!

The only thing ur choices affect are ur score and a few dialogues here and there, it doesn't affect the story at all. In subsequent play through u can almost skip the story entirely. This is the worst adventure book I've picked up. I regretted buying the entire series at 1 go, should have played through the 1st book before doing that. The writing is amateurish, I could have written that when I was 15.
Great game great character played over and over still love it

I played through the whole first game in one night because I couldn't put it down! I have never felt so engaged by a story! This game is well worth the price because I got more enjoyment out of it than most of my Xbox games which cost 20x as much. BUY THIS GAME!!!

Played through this and what an amazing storyline it has, the setting is unique and it plays out like some superhero movie blockbuster! And to my suprise, there is a sequel! Definitely worth the purchase, many hours of superhero story fun!
Was skeptical but I really loved it
Very good start to the series
This trilogy was so worth waiting for!  The story was engaging and the romantic element seemed important to the plot without being a mandatory subplot.  Fantastic.
Its like reading an eBook staring a superhero you.  Replaying all of three to see how the options change the story.

A little railroady but it works in context. The choices you have to make are interesting and the setting plays on the two sides of the superhero genre: fame and agency versus heroism and the responsibilities of choosing a heroic life.
Amazing story that would make for an awesome movie series. Loved the world and the characters in it. I liked the idea of how people started to gain their powers.
Wasn't as hooked as some of their other games even though I thought this would hook me the most. The twist at the end was... really unexpected and very sad, which I suppose is a plus.

*slight spoiler... kinda* It feels like I'm forced to accept this weird morality that is clearly the view of the author that if I kill a certain person, I'm a murderer, even if it's to save a large number of innocents. This doesn't line up with my own morals, so the opinion feels forced on me by the author.
The games themself are really good, but the permissions required are fishy, to say the least (cannot See, why it requires any perms at all)
The twists are twisty

I really enjoyed playing this game! Really enjoyed the choose your own adventure feel. The only thing I really didn't enjoy was that once you click next you can't go back and re-read what just happened and if you accidentally choose one option you're stuck with it. But overall a very fun and addictive game!
Nope, this feels like it was written by a 3rd grader, its corny, and unbelievable, not really worth your money at all.

As other people have done, this is a review for the entire series as a whole. The story is fantastic. It is so well-done and I'm really, really going to miss it. I hope that there is more to come, and I highly recommend it.
Wasn't expecting that from a text based RPG :)
Emotionally draining but worth it

This is probably my favorite choice of games game. I don't usually write reviews but this one deserves it. Hours of game play, tons of character possibility and a really immersive world. I just wish you could pick your powers. But even that isn't worth a star. I can't wait for the sequels and other series by this writer
You guy should make one where you play as the villain

I'm rating not only this instalment, but the series as whole. Why? Well, I'm giving them all the same rating; also, the more time you invest in following your hero, the more difficult it becomes to put the story down. Just one more decision, one more chapter, etc. I spent many an hour past my bed time to discover what fate had in store for my dear protagonist. I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys a great read and doesn't mind staying up late to get swept away by it's story. Well, Hero, will you rise?
This game was a surprise hit for me, and has turned me on to the company and I look very much forward to playing more of their stories.
Funniest most addicting app ever hope love the story and was was written really well
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this game and the other 2 sequels as well. Well done! <3 Lots of fun, its a big game where I feel your choices matter. I felt like I got a lot out of this for the money!
Good read.
On my seventh play through and still get excited, I wish it had a little more choices that matter involving your powers and sidekick, but still great.

Also, it seems tht the "Legend" scale isn't too flexible w/ ur choices, making for a linear plot. Otherwise, for $3, definitely worth it. Hours upon hours of gameplay just to try out different character dimensions/outcomes.
By far the best choice of game I've ever played.  This particular series is so well written I had to buy all three in the trilogy.

Not as good as the other choice games. Your decisions don't affect anything. Too generic, doesn't require a lot of thought. Figured you could choose your powers, costume, fighting style, nope. Thought it would read like DC or Marvel, nope. Its like reading a comic written by someone who doesn't read comics. Only on chapter 3, already bored. Wish there had been a free sample before purchase.
Excellent

This is more an interactive story than a game, so if you're looking for a "game" in the traditional sense, you're likely to end up disappointed. It's also mostly a linear affair, but your decisions do affect the outcomes of smaller events and the story as a whole.  If that doesn't bother you, you'll likely enjoy this and its sequels. I was taken in by the story and really enjoyed the interactive aspects. My only real complaint is that there's no way to backtrack without dying or having to start over from the beginning.  Note: I saw this game on Steam before I knew it was on Android. While I don't think Steam is the right venue for a game like this, it works quite well on a mobile device.
Really fun and cool storyline
Really enjoyed it
I had all but one achievments and the legend guide unlocked suddenly it has all disappeared
Suddenly removed from supported devices my KindleFire. And now i cant replay this story. Nice work guys.
Fun
The game is way too linear and some of the choices doesn't seem to matter regardless of what you choose.  Still the game was entertaining.
It's very detailed and contains many hard decisions. I strongly recommend you guys to try it. :)
It was awesome loved the story but it did feel too linear.

Many people say how linear it is and how the choices don't matter is a big deal, but I don't see the problem. The choices do matter; they affect what happens to the character, and how, but they don't alter the overall storyline, after all, it's an interactive novel, not an open world game. As for character personality,  I find it very customizable. There are certain aspects that are necessary for it to fit with the storyline/world/background, but I feel the choices greatly change the character's personality

Not good. You can't customize your MC: they'll have a power you can't choose, a personality you can't change. They think things on their own and say things you don't want them to say. It's annoying, especially when you just finished much better CoG games like Zombie Exodus or Sabres of Infinity. The story is also very linear. It's as if the author has already decided how he wants his story to turn out, and all the choices are present just so it could fit the game format. Not recommended.
This is one if the better choice of games titles with a nice self-contained story and choices that matter to your character. If you like a good story this is one for you.
Great own adventure game
Truly one of kind...
The story really pulls you in. Makes you root not just for your character but also for the villain (or that might be just me).
But it's a little too short

I read both this book and sequel and to be honest I prefer this book but the second one is more of a bridge between two books and I hope they can deliver on the third book I'm really looking forward to it

This is is the reason I love COG so much, you gods of creation. Everything in it was brilliant. Best of all, I felt decisions made throughout the game had actual impacts on the options available to me throughout the story. I remain your greatest apostle. Please keep making more amazing games for me to enjoy!

This is easily one of the best of this sort of game; don't let the negative reviews deter you, they're written by idiots. The writing is poignant and evocative. You would be terribly remiss if you passed up this gem of a game. Just finished part 2, brilliant as well, although it is a bit frustrating that you can make perfect decisions the whole way; and things still won't work out for you. But, such is life, and good art exists to make us think and to entertain. Epic work friend.
The hero series has turned into one of my favorite series. I don't even care for Super hero stuff but this has a really genuine character.
I liked how your choices lead into the next game as well.

I've been a fan of Choice of Games for a while, so I didn't mind spending the money to get this one, and it's worth it. The choices are amazing, you get really invested in the storyline, and the plot is amazing. A very good game altogether, along with its sequel, can't wait for the third installment.
It's worth it. Good story decent length.
So well written.  I just wish there were daytime and nighttime themes. The white background is murder on my eyes.
Love it
The storyline is quite engrossing anddd you're free to play it anyway you see fit. Undoubtedly one of my favorite "choice of" games, next to choice of kung fu ^_^

I love the idea, the stats are dynamic, it's a good length, the characters have personality, but  I feel that the book itself is extremely linear, to the point that it is only interactive to a small degree, and the mc is practically forced into blunder regardless of your choices. Plus, at least half of the choices were utterly fake.
Well written

At first, it seemed alright, but while playing it, this remarkable thing happened. The character became me, I noticed that the choices I was putting in were the choices I would make myself. This game definitely is very involved, this one and the second one are THE best choice of games I have ever played, also the most heart-wrenching, rewarding, and painful. ( The latter due to a couple of choices I had made. ) Definitely worth the time, emotions and money.
Very fun story.
Great read.
Well worth the money and absolutely love it!
Well written and interesting but it railroads a lot of the situations and you have to follow the script no matter your choices.
Very compelling and thought out choices. Drove my emotions into it quite well.
The story was awesome as well as the setting.

This game or book is one of the best book in the "choice of" novels it's so engaging you will really feel that you are part of the story. The drama, the plot etc. Everything in a comic or novel or any story book for that matter is present here although the cons are although minor are  the character development, the change of scene, the phasing, etc.my suggestions/comment: Please make this title or book or episode run atleast 6 or 7 more, make a happy ending were you and your chosen one will settle in
I started playing this again when the sequel was released...and I was blown away all over again! It's a definite proof of how well the story was composed. Kudos!
Awesome!
Keep playing it, trying to figure out different things on increasing scores and relationships! I wish there was a guide for the Victons... Jury fan~! XD
Loving this
Really good
Good game
Having it's ups and downs as things progressed.  Still very entertaining.
Good stuff
Great story choices make you think would like it more if you had some say about your powers but it was for the story
This is probably my new favorite. Well worth the money to play. Definitely hope a sequel comes out to continue on with my character. That would be awesome. Keep it up. Make more games!!
Great writing.  Great choices. Excellent replay value.

The plot was, for the most part, a bit linear. The downside to that is it lessened the replay value by a lot, but the writing itself is so good that while you're playing it you don't really notice. The romance could have been further developed but it was by no means shoehorned in; I mean who didn't love Black Magic? Deserves the 5 stars, along with Slammed! it is definitely one of the my favorite CoGs.

After reading the reviews, I was sold. Then, after two playthroughs of the game I realized I had done it all. Most of the time you're drug though the plot no matter what you do, and after a few shots I realized that my choices didn't matter. There are way too many "fixed points" for a choice game. SPOILERS AHEAD:  You always botch the Gravitas job the same The police are never really on your side Your sidekick choice never seriously matters The Splice Group always fizzles out The people are never pleased
Not as many choices are available, but it was still one of the most engaging games I've had the pleasure of playing.
Upgraded phone, lost everything I previously had. Only downfall was that I had to repurchase it. Still one of my favorites cog.
Can't wait for the squeal
Love it. Hope there'll be continuation to the story. Maybe more romance scene next??
I was really impressed by not only the story but the choices and the overall length and polish. Thoroughly enjoyable.
The story, setting, characters. A real treat to read. Don't let the price fool you. Its worth it.
So good that i want a second one

When I first purchased this game, I was not expecting a 5 hour play through that drove out as many emotions as reading any book but that's what I got. A great storyline with so many different endings, so many choices to chose from, and a wild adventure that leaves you begging for more! One of my favorites :)
I can't wait for a new part! Its a great game every one should try!

Just finished this in about 4 or 5 hours on a road trip. One of the best CoG. It felt very in depth and we'll written with choices that made you think. Highly recommended.
Great game and well worth the money, best of type. Pay play and fun.

This game was perfect in everyway! I was deeply immersed in the entire story and enjoyed every second. It is really worth the money! I really hope they come put with a second part,I loved it that much!
Got me hooked, a little linear, and the story can be somewhat sloppy at times but I absolutely look forward to part two.
1. What's the highest relationship level with Black Magic? 2. What's the door password? 3. If you die in this easy game... Kill yourself.
Long and engaging story definitely worth 2.99
This is the best choice of game i have ever played. Can't wait for the next one.
Was thoroughly enthralled. Well done! Can't wait for the next one

But this game was well worth the 2$ I spent on it.  I have played most of the choice games and this one was by far the best.  It was very thought out and had only a few grammatical errors.  Though I almost chose 4stars because many of the choices it seems really change the outcome more your characters attitude towards the situation.  Over all great read though.
Probably my favourite choice of games story. I've already played it more than once.

This game is amazing.  Will a part 2 come out?
Very very good, would love to be able to choose your own power though, however I know this could be complicated. Absolutely fantastic
Really fun. Played it a couple times so it doesnt lose entertainment

Was unsure about paying for this at first, but thought why not I loved the free choice games,  The story is great and is really intresting, The brances that you have to pick from all give you the sence that your incontrol and never being pushed to one answer more than another, I say if you like text-based games 100% get this. Cant wait for the next installment
This games is worth. The money but it I played 20 times and am not bored with AMAZING GAME

Good concept - but lazy job, resulting in the worst of them all. Truly. Save your money. All the answers lead to the same place. This was a great disappointment, because the idea of heroes was a good one.
There are no meaningful choices to make in the game, and there's no real replay value. I was quite disappointed with this.
I really like it! So worth buying just wish there was a bit more romance and options.
The best one so far can't wait for the next one

Grest fun way to waste some time. What else can you do for less than 2pounds

Thoroughly enjoyed this game. Couldnt put it down!! Hurry up part 2!!

I. Love. This. The story kept me on the edge of my seat wondering what was going to happen next or if I made the right choice. Like other reviews suggested, I would love to see a more romantic side to future stories (I absolutely loved the interaction between my character and Black Magic.) I will be impatiently waiting for the next installment of this excellent series!
I actually felt like I had a connection with the characters. I hated the mayor, I felt like I was rivals with Jury. My morals seemed to flow right into the story.

I've had this since it was first released and I still find it amusing to read. This has to be one of the best ones ever made and I've tried nearly all of them. The plot is well written with twists and decisions that test your character. Im waiting on the sequel. Also, as stated by other users, wider selections in the romantic side to the story would be nice, maybe something to incorporate into the next installment of the heros line?

Really enjoyable storyline and plot twists, can't wait for the next installment! Definitely something I'd purchase :) It'd be nice for my character to have more romantic options though, instead of just the one character Black Magic (I chose straight) still kept me immersed though!
Really
I've ever played, without any debate.
This is very well written, but less interactive than other games from choice of games.  I would strongly recommend this game to anyone who likes IF, just realize it is slightly linear.
I really enjoyed this. The customization options were nice too. I would like to see better character descriptions but the drama was excellent. Looking forward to the next chapter in my journey

I love your games and this one was your best one yet. Super in-depth and engaging story and interesting characters. Probably the best Choice of game so far. Likeable (and loathe-able!) Characters and a gripping story that's surprisingly powerful. Amazing work.

I love these. Keep them coming.
Nice story, fairly long even with the predictable twist.Well worth.
Good manipulation of settings and characters along with excellent  usage of tension. Really enjoyed playing this and it was worth every cent. Hope a sequel will be released! 8)
Bought this game last night and didn't stop playing it till I beat it. Loved the story and how my choices affected me. Like all their other games, Choice of Games has impressed me again.

Decent writing, extreme railroading, almost zero replayability. Most of the choices end up the same, the important plot event is not handled well, I can't even choose a decent response when the main character is being utterly stupid. 3/5 for effort and decent writing. Though it's just barely worth the price.
I may or may not have played through as Tony Stark ;)
Not as good as past books; could have been much better.

I absolutely loved this story! For a text based game, it was surprisingly emotional. I was actually invested in the characters and was genuinely sad when it was over. I do hope that the author plans to continue the series, perhaps expanding on the budding romance and the cliffhanger St the end? Terrific job. I see many replays in my future.
This is good but all the options lead to basicly the same thing

Great, funny, and intresting five stars. Hope theres a part 2

I've been a fan of Choice Of Games for sometime now but I must say that this is their best work yet. I highly recommend this and all of their other games to any fan of a good choose your own adventure story. Two thumbs way way up, I can not wait for a continuation to this story. I have been a fan of choice of games for a while... but this was even better than expected. Well worth the money, I hope to get many more books like this.

I loved the game but I wish the beginning options made your power choices. I see how the ones that were locked in were there for story purposes.

I've played all your games, but this one is hands down amazing. Though the array and impact of choices and the range in which the story can evolve isn't that great the story is brilliant. Sucked me in real hard. It was a real jaw dropping experience that I hope to feel again in a possible second part. Congratulations on the story, a real gem. I wish you good luck in future games, I'll hope I'll see a second part of this, but no matter what, I'll always buy your games, no matter the price, as soon as I can.
Really fun to play and I really enjoyed the story. Waiting for more from these guys.
With all the high tech games out there this old school text adventure is very enjoyable.

The writing is fine, and the scoring system works fine. However, after playing different ways a few times through, the story is too linear. Yes, you're granted different options, but in many areas it doesn't matter what you do - you're going to get the same result every time. That's frustrating to me and kills the replay value. Hopefully subsequent installments address this.
So good it was hard to stop reading
Worth the money though more flexibility with the storyline could be better.
It was a very fun game. I love these games. I hope Choice Of Games will continue producing these great games.
Kind of stupid how you can't manipulate the story line that much and how you always end up fighting prodigal other than that it's a good start
Great story, amazing characters, the story had so much depth. I strongly recommend everyone buy this game!!!

But could do better. Like adding additional stories, choose what power YOU want or have different beginings. Have more romance optains and additional ending like a part 2. But more importantly having the choice to be a villian or hero.

This has to be the best Choice of game yet! Its story definately sucked me in, and the length is longer than any of the other games so far. I was kinda skeptical about the superhero theme at first, but I quickly found out that I could not put this masterpeice down. I love every bit of this game, and i'm just hoping for more like this in the future!
Was a great game! Very creative! I loved all the different choices and routes you can take. Very cleverly designed.  Hope they add to this in the future!
My favourite "choice of" game so far. Well worth paying for; the preview hooked me well and good. I do wish there were alternative routes to avoid certain events, but this was excellent even so.
Really really fun to play, with a rich narritive that leaves you begging for more. Just finished it, now I'm going to try as Batman!

great writing,  innovative powers, interesting plot twists. some people complained was too childish, i don't know. as an adult it could've been a bit more serious and in depth, but overall it was very  good and i enjoyed playing again which i don't usually do. I AGREE w the reviewer who recommended at LEAST ONE "back button " per scene, after you've completed once maybe. i wish there had been an alternative storyline without the inevitable Sidekick twist. thanks for a great game.
Their best game so far! 5 stars. Any chance of a sequel?
I am a fan of choice games, this title was an interesting read but it lacked any meaningful choices. The story was very linear and the choices often resulted in the same result.
Another great text based game. Entertained me for hours.
Would be great to somehow get a sequel that accounted for our decisions in this one.
Well written story, my only complaint would be all choices tend to lead down the same path, good for one go through but replayabilty not as high as other choice games
Surprising amount of depth and overall a great story to interact with. Very inclusive of readers from all walks of life.
Very good game and story. But i think it wouldve been better to had been given the choice of choosing your own powers. Definetely looking forward to other titles.
A very good game, easily worth the money. The best one yet, and that's saying something :)
Loved it, hope there will be a sequel.

An genuinely fresh and engaging universe among the saturated popularity of the teenage superhero genre. Worth every penny, and would pay again for sequels.
Couldnt put down for 4 hours straight. Possibly best mobile game ever played. Get it
